page.title: 08Transport,Hoppas,St.Austell
page.content: The Hoppa bus service was started in November 1984 as a new circular service of mini-buses around St.Austell.These buses,made by Mercedes and carrying up to 19 passengers,start at 6.30a.m.to take early morning workers and those catching the first trains.They continue until 11p.m.on weekdays and between 8a.m. and 6p.m. they run every ten minutes.They link the main residential areas of St.Austell with the station and centre of the town. Hoppas are allowed to travel along Fore St.to pick up and put down passengers,although other traffic is banned.Outside the town centre these buses can be hailed by putting your hand up,and the driver will stop anywhere providing it is safe to do so.
